On Escalation Ticket # 00432024 the new comment has been added: Cecilia-Maria Iepure:

Please schedule the upgrade between 14:00 -17:00  CET, as in the past our devs indentify that during this slot the traffic is low on servers for BMW.

[DevOps CommentId:11509189]

On Escalation Ticket # 00432024 the new comment has been added: The customer has replied that 14:00 CET and 15:00 CET would be a good fit for their schedule.
Please choose a time from the ones above and also let me know who is required to attend in order to proceed with sending the invitation.
Thank you

On Escalation Ticket # 00432024 the new comment has been added: Cecilia-Maria Iepure:

 15:00 CET would be a good fit for us as well. I will provide soon the name of the dev which will jong the session.

[DevOps CommentId:11525460]

On Escalation Ticket # 00432024 the new comment has been added: Cecilia-Maria Iepure:

 15:00 CET would be a good fit for us as well. I will provide soon the name of the dev which will jong the session.

[DevOps CommentId:11525460]

On Escalation Ticket # 00432024 the new comment has been added: This is a translation from an email which I got yesterday from the Kilian Grimm / Unified Endpoint Management and Protection, Digital Office (he is our champion at BMW Team):

Unfortunately you had cancelled the appointment for today.

Unfortunately, as requested by Anatoli yesterday, we have not yet received a summary of why yesterday's attempt to update the ‘SaaS infrastructure’ to the latest version failed.

I'm still wondering why the update went smoothly in the INT environment and why a new update file was made available to us unannounced yesterday. I would also have expected the backup to be prepared before yesterday's deadline.

In addition, after the failure, the server load and the number of connected clients were pointed out as possible causes.

Sorry, but we can't just switch off all our clients in a hurry for an infrastructure update.

Unfortunately, our expectations are completely at odds with each other here, and this is a ‘SaaS infrastructure’ where I can't explain a manual update process anyway.

Please provide clarification and a plan on how such incidents can be prevented in the future and when a functional update will be available to us.

Kind Regards / Yours sincerely 

Kilian

On Escalation Ticket # 00432024 the new comment has been added: CS Claudia Kurbjuhn has reported the following after having today a call with BMW:


"BMW is asking for a Update Meeting on 10th of Feb (after 9PM or 13AM DE Time)  for the Prod Environment
They are also asking for Information about our testing, like how many logs are made and on how many clients we are testing.  They would love when we clone their Prod Environment and test it. (I am not sure if  this is possible) 
We should prepare a Backup before the meeting is taking place. "

Please advise, thank you

On Escalation Ticket # 00432024 the Following Fields have been updated: 
Priority has been changed to High.
Product Version has been changed to NONE.

On Escalation Ticket # 00432024 the Following Fields have been updated: 
Status has been changed to Awaiting Escalating Engineer.

On Escalation Ticket # 00432024 the new comment has been added: Cecilia-Maria Iepure:

@WaitingOnEngineer

The Upgrade Meeting can take place at 9PM.

Backup, prior to the Upgrade Meeting - we just need approval from BMW, and 1 h prior to the Upgrade Meeting, engineers can prepare the backup. This action can take place at 8PM, Monday 10th, just please confirm if that's ok and we have BMW approval.

Details about testing:

A brief QA scenerio will look like:

	 - 	Applying the patches on the environment
	 - 	Generate logs while patch is applying (connect disconnect different devices), logs should not enter in system and EPP Client is disconnected, ERROR recorded in EPP client logs and also visible in EPP Client interface

	 - 	After 720 patch is applied - check DC logs (logs are entering the system), create a CAP policy and trigger the policy (logs are present in the system), check logs both DC and CAP, connect a new device, check device list to see that new device is registered, install EPP Client on a new machine (client is registered and communicating), change different device rights, Change machine users (check if rights are correctly applied for each user)


Normally, we try and replicate about 15k agents ( ping , reprovision, connect ) requests and logs per day we try and get to about 250 rps (requests/logs per second) 

Below you can see part of the results made by our automation team:




 

[DevOps CommentId:11603807]
On Escalation Ticket # 00432024 the new comment has been added: Hi Cecilia-Maria Iepure thank you for the feedback.

On Escalation Ticket # 00432024 the Following Fields have been updated: 
Status has been changed to Awaiting Client.

On Escalation Ticket # 00432024 the new comment has been added: The customer has replied after we applied yesterday the 7.2.0 patch:

The login is functional and the correct EPP Server version is displayed. However, we cannot open the logs

[Report and Analysis/ Log reports - error message - An unexpected error occured. Please contact your system administrator if the error persists]

and at connected server an instance is shown as offline

[ CrateDB Instance 2 is Offline ]

Please let me know when you would like to troubleshoot this.
Thank you

On Escalation Ticket # 00432024 the new comment has been added: error from the backend logs:

[2025-02-12 14:24:11] app.ERROR: AppSharedInfrastructureSymfonyApiExceptionListener::onException #An exception occurred while executing 'SELECT dl._id, dl.event_name, dl.machine_name, dl.ip, dl.domain, dl.client_name, dl.device_type_name, dl.device_name, dl.ur_justification, dl.ur_time_interval, dl.vid, dl.pid, dl.serial_no, dl.file_name, dl.file_type, dl.os_type, dl.timestamp, dl.epp_client_version, dl.event_time_local, dl.shadow_exists, dl.shadow_is_deleted, dl.shadow_repo_type, dl.department_id, dl.log_type, dl.event_id, dl.os_version, dl.file_hash, dl.machine_id, dl.file_size, dl.epp_server_id FROM dc_logs dl ORDER BY event_time_local DESC LIMIT 100 OFFSET 99900'

On Escalation Ticket # 00432024 the new comment has been added: We had a call today with the customer regarding the Log Reports that are not loading after applying the 7.2.0 patch and could see in the developer tools that an error "500 internal error" comes up when loading the Log Reports section. Mihaela did some operations in the backend and after that the page began to load showing 10 log entries per page.
As they changed to 100 or 500 entries per page, the first page would load, but after clicking to the next page, the issue reappeared.
At the time of the remote session they had 186031040 logs present.
Please investigate further and let me know if I can assist you in any way.

On Escalation Ticket # 00432024 the new comment has been added: Ticket has been closed from the customer side:

Please close the escalated ticket as well.
